Reason: The configuration option cdc_free_space_check_interval_ms in the Cassandra project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the interval at which the system checks for free space in the commit log directory. A lower value for this configuration can lead to more frequent checks for free space, potentially causing increased overhead and impacting system performance. Conversely, a higher value may result in delayed detection of low disk space, leading to potential performance issues or system failures. Therefore, any change in the value of cdc_free_space_check_interval_ms can significantly affect system performance in terms of execution time and resource consumption.
